definitions.definition: to behave in a dishonest way in order to get what you want:
examples: Anyone caught cheating will be immediately disqualified from the exam.

definitions.definition: a person who behaves in a dishonest way:
examples: Trouble broke out in the match when one of the players called a member of the other team a cheat.

definitions.definition: something dishonest that makes people believe that something is true when it is not:
examples: You can use cocoa powder to make the cake rather than chocolate - it's a bit of a cheat, but nobody notices the difference.

definitions.definition: a collection of instructions or special information that someone can use to help them play a computer game more successfully:
